text:

[Student]: Well I was born in London and my father is an actor and this is all because of him as an entertainer but its also partly his job in movies which he writes about himself as well as other people like me who are interested in acting so they can hear more than what their fans think
[Teacher]: and also to give people a chance to read their own stories and be more understanding of people in general. The same goes for my mother who is a painter, so you can see the connection between acting and painting, it's all about creativity and bringing your own ideas to life. I love music and I do enjoy listening to a variety of genres, but my favorite artist is David Bowie. I find his music to be very thought-provoking and inspiring, and I think he's one of the most innovative and influential musicians of all time. I'm also a big fan of Queen, and I've been lucky enough to see them live in concert a few times. Their music is just incredible, and Freddie Mercury's voice is truly one of the greatest in rock music. I've also been a fan of Elton John for many years, and I've had the chance to see him live a few times as well. He's just so talented and charismatic on stage, and his music is always

[Teacher]: his work in the musical the Lion King in 1997, and the American Idol competition that year. He has been one of the most successful musicians in the world for many years and has won numerous awards including multiple Grammy Awards, Academy Awards, Golden Globe Awards, and multiple Brit Awards.  So that was my first impression of you. Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience that you would like to share with me? Do you enjoy a particular genre of music? It allows the speaker and the listener to establish a friendly atmosphere and find a common interest.  It is not necessary to be afraid of having pets, and there is no need to be afraid of someone who knows how to talk to animals. The quote in the passage is a famous one from the novel Wuthering Heights by Emily Brontë. The quote suggests that the narrator and her mother are close and understanding of each other, and that they can have open and

[Teacher]: , but in truth she had no idea at all how to react. She knew that some people are keenly interested in things that others can never imagine. Everyone has a different sense of taste in these things. But still it's a little puzzling to see people who have such interests spend so much time on them. The first thing she noticed about the two men is that they were both sitting in comfortable chairs in the room, their legs stretched out in front of them, a nice bottle of wine in their hands, and they were both smiling, happy, relaxed. This was not some gloomy or brooding, or anxious conversation. No, it was a conversation that had come from deep within them. text:
[Starter]: What kind of music do you usually listen to? Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember?
[Student]: I know people who come in to visit me every week on the Sunday afternoons and try to play guitar at home as much as they likedthe boys are such fun
[Teacher]: to listen to. But it's not exactly the most inspiring music to sit in a silence of a library. So I try to find common ground, and find the music that resonates with us all. We play some popular music, like Taylor Swift and Ed Sheeran, but I also find some local artists that come to visit me sometimes. They play acoustic songs that are so pure and lovely, and they are usually from the genre of folk or indie-folk. The music is often very mellow, and it creates a peaceful atmosphere that is perfect for studying.   For me, the most memorable concert experience is when I saw The Beatles live in concert in London, 1969. It was truly an incredible experience that I will never forget. The energy of the crowd was electric, and the band's performance was so mesmerizing that it felt like a spiritual experience. I was so lucky to have experienced it, and it's a memory that I cherish forever.  I have to say
